name: Tech & Engineering
description: Software development, cloud infrastructure, and engineering insights

items.title: Rust 2.0 Roadmap: What's Coming in the Next Major Release
items.author: Rust Core Team
items.excerpt: The Rust team has published the roadmap for Rust 2.0, scheduled for late 2026. Key features include improved async ergonomics, a new trait solver, and breaking changes to improve consistency.

items.title: Kubernetes 1.32: Gateway API Goes GA
items.author: SIG Network
items.excerpt: Gateway API reaches General Availability in Kubernetes 1.32. This marks the end of Ingress as the recommended approach for HTTP routing, with Gateway providing a more expressive and extensible model.

items.title: The State of WebAssembly 2026
items.author: Lin Clark
items.excerpt: WebAssembly adoption in server-side environments has grown 300% in the past year. The component model is now widely supported, enabling true language interoperability at near-native performance.

items.title: DynamoDB Single-Table Design: A Practical Guide
items.author: Rick Houlihan
items.excerpt: This guide walks through designing a single-table DynamoDB schema for a real-world e-commerce application. We cover access patterns, GSI design, and strategies for handling complex queries.

items.title: Why We Moved from Microservices to a Modular Monolith
items.author: David Hansson
items.excerpt: After four years of microservices complexity, we rebuilt our platform as a modular monolith. Deployment frequency increased 5x, incidents dropped 80%, and developer happiness improved significantly.

items.title: Comparing Edge Compute Platforms: Cloudflare, Fastly, and Vercel
items.author: Zach Leatherman
items.excerpt: A deep dive into the three major edge compute platforms. We benchmark cold start times, runtime limits, and pricing at various scales to help you choose the right platform for your use case.

items.title: SQLite as a Primary Database: Lessons from Production
items.author: Kurt Mackey
items.excerpt: We've been running SQLite as the primary database for thousands of applications on Fly.io. Here's what we've learned about replication, backup strategies, and when SQLite is (and isn't) the right choice.

items.title: GitHub Actions: Advanced Workflow Patterns
items.author: GitHub Actions Team
items.excerpt: Learn advanced GitHub Actions patterns including matrix builds, reusable workflows, and composite actions. Includes real-world examples from popular open source projects.
